definitions.definition: To render unable; to take away an ability of, as by crippling.
(chiefly of a person) To impair the physical or mental abilities of; to cause a serious, permanent injury.
definitions.example: Falling off the horse disabled him.

definitions.definition: To deactivate, to make inoperational (especially of a function of an electronic or mechanical device).
definitions.example: The pilot had to disable the autopilot of his airplane.

definitions.definition: One who is disabled. (often used collectively as the disabled, but sometimes also singular)
Made incapable of use or action.
